poem:
### Vaporous Lament

Plastic puffs snake through young lungs,  
unseen shadows of a neon glow,  
as innocence drifts on chemical wings.  
Invisible toxins dance, unbidden—  
a masquerade of molecular whispers.  
Youth's folly twirls in ghostly clouds,  
forever laced with nicotine's grip,  
a breath of what's lost, tethered to mist.
